verses.verse: And he said<WH559> unto me<WH1121>, Son of man<WH120>, stand<WH5975> upon your feet<WH7272>, and I will speak unto you<WH1696>.
And the spirit<WH7307> entered<WH935> into me when he spoke<WH1696> unto me<WH5975>, and set me upon my feet<WH7272>, that I heard<WH8085> him that spoke unto me<WH1696>.

And he said<WH559> unto me<WH1121>, Son of man<WH120>, I send<WH7971> you to the sons<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478>, to a rebellious<WH4775> nation<WH1471> that has rebelled<WH4775> against me<WH1>: they and their fathers have transgressed<WH6586> against me<WH6106>, even unto this very day<WH3117>.
For they are impudent<WH7186> sons<WH1121> and stiffhearted<WH2389>. I do send<WH7971> you unto them<WH559>; and you shall say unto them<WH559>, Thus says the Lord<WH136> God<WH3069>.

And they<WH8085>, whether they will hear, or whether they will forbear<WH2308>, (for they are a rebellious<WH4805> house<WH1004>,) yet shall know<WH3045> that there has been a prophet<WH5030> among them<WH8432>.

And you<WH1121>, son of man<WH120>, be not afraid<WH3372> of them<WH3372>, neither be afraid of their words<WH1697>, though briars<WH5621> and thorns<WH5544> be with you<WH3427>, and you do live among scorpions<WH6137>: be not afraid<WH3372> of their words<WH1697>, nor be dismayed<WH2865> at their looks<WH6440>, though they be a rebellious<WH4805> house<WH1004>.
And you shall speak<WH1696> my words<WH1697> unto them<WH8085>, whether they will hear, or whether they will forbear<WH2308>: for they are most rebellious<WH4805>.

But you<WH1121>, son of man<WH120>, hear<WH8085> what I say<WH1696> unto you<WH1961>; Be not rebellious<WH4805> like that rebellious<WH4805> house<WH1004>: open<WH6475> your mouth<WH6310>, and eat<WH398> what I give you<WH5414>.
And when I looked<WH7200>, behold<WH3027>, a hand was sent<WH7971> unto me<WH4039>; and, behold, a roll of a book was in it<WH5612>;

And he spread<WH6566> it before<WH6440> me<WH3789>; and it was written on both the inside<WH6440> and the outside<WH268>: and there was written<WH3789> in it lamentations<WH7015>, and mourning<WH1899>, and woe<WH1958>.
